page.title: 09The Maltings
page.content: The{Maltings}stands beside the river. 100 years ago it must have been a very pleasant sight as barges unloaded barley and loaded up with barrels of salt or cargoes of wood.Now the {Maltings}have almost closed working. Instead many of the buildings have been altered and small firms have taken over parts of them, making it a mini-shopping estate. Carpet warehouses, bathroom equipment, antiques, tyre sellers and wine merchants all compete with each other. The goods no longer go by river but by road; a continuous stream of traffic is always turning into or out of the main road bringing customers or equipment to keep these places provided with stock.
